intro: Lachnaea gracilis, commonly known as the slender lachnaea, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its delicate, narrow leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Lachnaea gracilis is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along the edges of woodland areas. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to gardens and a valuable component of local ecosystems.
